Reviews.Title: “Good quality hotel”
Reviews.Author: goranich
Reviews.Content: I have stayed hear on Easter 2012 and the accommodation was very good. The rooms are big and clean, breakfast was plentiful and good. Hotel has a wi-fi connection but I was unable to connect from the room most of the time. You also get a free computer use in the lobby. The only downside for this hotel is that it is a bit far from the metro (about 10-15 minutes by foot) but there is a bus station nearby with 2 bus lines that can take you directly to Sagrada familia.

Reviews.Title: “3 days in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: cheryl p
Reviews.Content: the room was a good size but looking quite 'tired', the a/c wasn't working as well as it could but didn't need it after our first day as it rained and the temp. dropped.The receptionist on our arrival was miserable and we generally found all the staff very unhelpful, they appeared annoyed that you had asked them directions or advise. Not the easiest hotel to find, even the locals didn't seem to know where it was. We got the Airport coach which was 5.30 euros each and got off 2 stops later at Urgell. The T10 ticket for the metro was worth buying and we enjoyed the sightseeing bus.I don't think I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very good value!”
Reviews.Author: Sheep25
Reviews.Content: I also booked in this hotel through Easyjet. The reception staff were outstandingly helpful when my luggage didn't arrive. Breakfasts were excellent. Does need updating and needs Kleenex. But really the staff were so competent and friendly I would return here for this alone!

Reviews.Title: “Great service, room updating needed”
Reviews.Author: ontheotherside
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the "AB Viladomat" for a few nights last month. The service is outstanding, with great staff assisting throughout. The hotel is reasonably quiet. The only thing missing is some upgrade in the rooms as one feels in the middle of the 1980's and this is a bit depressing. I still prefer the "Praktik" hotel on the Rambla de Catalunya, where I have stayed a couple of times.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable Hotel in a Great City”
Reviews.Author: HPHAS
Reviews.Content: I and a friend stayed here for 2 nights; she was on a work assignment. The hotel is in a good location; not for the beach but for the city. The rooms are generous and comfortable; free wifi and minibar. Bathroom was nice though had no tissues/kleenex. Breakfast was quite good; full buffet including eggs and meats. The waiter will make you an espresso or capuccino if you don't like the machine. The front desk and waitstaff were all helpful and pleasant. The price was reasonable for the facility.

Reviews.Title: “Will stay here again next time in barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Brian1954
Reviews.Content: The Hotel was booked online by a Spanish colleague - Friendly and efficient reception staff, Excellent free WiFi and very clean, comfortable room. A very wide choice of hot, cold sweet and savoury items at Breakfast. Everything one could ask for in a city centre hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Service with a smile”
Reviews.Author: Ray836
Reviews.Content: We bookedthe hotel on the internet, so were not sure exactly what to expect. We were booked into a twin room (double requested) but changed immediately and without fuss to a double on arrival, after being given the opportunity to check it first. The weather was very cold, and initially the room was a little chilly, but the staff were quick and helpful in dealing with this. Breakfast was good and varied, staff were always friendly and helpful with matters in the hotel and with advice about the city and getting around. For me the make-or-break feature can be the shower, and this was superb - powerful and hot. Great weekend despite the near-freezing weather. Would thoroughly recommend the hotel - proven by the excellent way the staff dealt with the little hitches.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: JambaLayaSuffolk
Reviews.Content: This hotel came up first when looking for a hotel booked at the same time as my Easyjet flight to Barcelona. The service at the hotel was excellent from check-in to check-out. Front of house staff were very obliging and friendly, the food was good and not as over-priced as some hotels in the city with very attentive service from the gentleman at the bar. The room I had was quiet and peaceful and at 10 Euros, breakfast was excellent - fried or scrambled eggs, bacon, and sausage as well as the normal fare. Catalunya Square is about fifteen minutes walk away; allowing streets to be encountered that otherwise wouldn't be. I'd definitely book again, especially at 42 Euros !

Reviews.Title: “Ignore the bad reviews!!!”
Reviews.Author: Amy W
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the reviews of this hotel I was not sure what to expect. However, I can safely say that the poorer reviews were quite frankly rubbish. We had a lovely 4 days stay with my partner at the hotel over new year. Staff were all very friendly, welcoming and helpful, Rooms were clean and spacious and breakfast was also very nice. Mini bar prices were very reasonable. As for location, I read how it was 20 minutes and so on from the metro… Again, nonsense. Metro station Entance was just a 5-7 minute walk away and the metro was very impressive. So frequent and easy to get around. Would highly recommend a T10 ticket for the metro, which gives you 10 journeys. On the machine it gives you the option of 1 zone for around 8.95. There are options for 2 zones and 3 zones for more money but on the one zone ticket we got around all of town so this is all you will need. On new years eve we visited restaurant Montjuic El Xalet. Breathtaking setting and views. Food was nice but very expensive and extremely small portions. Would still recommend as it was a great experience. A walk down Las Ramblas is essential, we ended up doing it twice and while there visit the food market. You must taste the kinder flavoured ice cream! The fresh fruit juices that you will see everywhere there are tasty at first but far too many pips so be warned! The Cathedral is also a must see and also go in the lift to the roof, great experience. I was slightly disappointed by the Sagrada Familia, they have renovated it so much it is almost not cultural any more, too modern. The Nou Camp was also a brilliant day out as a football fan. A great stay in Barcelona. Would highly recommend the Hotel AB Viladomat.

Reviews.Title: “A great choice!”
Reviews.Author: nina385
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my sister and friend in the room 710 which has a terrace with a great view. We watched New Year's fireworks feom it! It's pristine clean, the staff is pleasent, helpful and speaks fluent English. We came before our check-in time, and the room was ready for us. After check-out, we were able to leave our baggage (free of charge) until late afternoon when our flight was due. Location is very good, only 6-7min walking from the metro station Hospital Clinic, and in a very peaceful, upscale neighbourhood. It's olso only about 25min walk from the city centre, Placa de Catalunya. Definetely recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel but very noisy in room, bed is back breaking”
Reviews.Author: tourking
Reviews.Content: Generally hotel is great, clean, friendly, ok location, bedrooms look great foR the money. Only issue we had was we were located on the first floor and front windows were single glazed so noise was bad, and on top of the bed was the worst I,ve ever slept in, my problem really should of asked for a replacement mattress.

Reviews.Title: “A good pick in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: dnp2302
Reviews.Content: This hotel may not be right in the middle of everything but its only a couple metros stops from it. This was a good pick in Barcelona as the hustle and bustle and all the noise of the center is too much for a good nights sleep. Very clean rooms and decent size room size. We would recommend this hotel if staying in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid for business”
Reviews.Author: philip_torr
Reviews.Content: Came here for conference at FIRA nearby Had to work whilst here and internet is constantly breaking down and even when it works is not too good Booked in advance via a travel agent, wanted to check out early but hotel would not refund any money for room, very unprofessional On the positive side the reception desk staff were over all quite nice, but I could not recommend this hotel for any business traveller.

Reviews.Title: “Well situtated hotel”
Reviews.Author: chill0ut_traveller
Reviews.Content: this hotel is ok in the average...very well situated....rooms are ok...service was good....breakfast was also ok....hotel does not provide parking...but there is a public parkng in front of it.....it has wifi service for free...

Reviews.Title: “My first really bad experience”
Reviews.Author: Judith F
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel was not convenient. It was 7 or 8 blocks away from the nearest metro station. The wifi in the hotel was more like a wireless dialup connection. I was rarely able to stay connected for more than 5 minutes. 3 different front desk receptionists gave me 3 different pieces of information when I tried to schedule transportation from the hotel to the airport. They told me 3 different prices: 30euros, 50euros, and 25euros. Also, I scheduled pickup with the evening person for 9am the next morning and saw her write it down on their calendar. When I tried to confirm the pickup the next morning, another lady told me I would have to go outside to hail a taxi because there were no taxis available. She then tried to explain, rudely, that it is hard to reserve a taxi for 5 ppl and that the supply is limited in Barcelona. Ok, but why wasnt this explained to me by the other 2 women I spoke to? I would not recommend this hotel because of bad service and inconvenient location.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Paul R
Reviews.Content: Hotel is out of the city centre, however close to Rockafort Metro station... around a 10 minute walk. Hotel is clean, bright and staff that we encountered was happy and helpful directing us to the local metro. The hotel has free wifi you just need to get a code from reception. There was some bars, bistros and restaurants near the hotel along with some local shops. The hotel is just out of the tourist area so you encounter the locals and experience the real Barcelona. All in all a good hotel and if was visiting Barcelona again I would book here again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean friendly well positioned and quiet”
Reviews.Author: MikeOgilvie
Reviews.Content: Well placed with a twenty minute walk from sants station or close for taxis - a clean quiet hotel with airconditioning that works Friendly service - a nice breakfast and excellent value for money

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Quality for the Price”
Reviews.Author: BaltimoreFats
Reviews.Content: Loved the solid wood floors. The room was clean and functional at a good price. The front desk was extremely helpful with all of my questions, and they knew English. Good breakfast. Bartender was nice, had a short chat. Bank machine across the street. Short walk from the subway, the Etenca stop, which is one stop from Sans Estacio that connects to the airport. Also short walk to the red line that goes to Las Ramblas. Only drawback might be hearing the street noise at night, as I was in a corner room.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel with a long walk to the Metro”
Reviews.Author: KPDiggit
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean and reasonably comfortable but it lacks character and so does the are in which it is situated - not a very inspiring part of Barcelona. We could have lived with that if it wasn't so far away from the Metro- a minimum of a 20 minute walk which in the heat wasn't fun. On top of that there were very few restaurants (and shops) within walking distance of the hotel and they were all decidely average. So unless you are happy to walk back and forth to the Metro I would avoid this hotel and find something more centrally located.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money - great family rooms (adjacent)”
Reviews.Author: ArneD
Reviews.Content: Although the hotel interior is a little bit dated and worn, and the hotel isn´t smack central downtown Barcelona, I´ll have to give kudos to the hotel for both beeing good value for money and have great rooms for a family. We (family of four) got two adjacent rooms with a common entrance and hallway, so that the doors to the rooms could be open during the night, and the children could come into our room unobstructed. The rooms was spacious, clean and nice. A little bit dated interior - but that was expected. The beds are OK, but a little bit hard for our taste. We also used the hotel parking for all 3 days we stayed (EUR 20 pr day), and bought 3 day passes on the metro to get around Barcelona. We used the Roqafort metro-station on the red line, which was just 4 blocks from the hotel. Would recommend for people traveling with kids. Just make sure to specify adjacent rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money!”
Reviews.Author: Kathsl22
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I arrived back from Barcelona yesterday after 4 nights stay in the AB Viladomat. We chose the hotel based on the location, affordable room rates and the positive reviews on tripadvisor and were not disappointed! The staff are very friendly, especially the bar man who will happily top your strawberry mojita up with extra rum at no additional charge! :) The rooms were (as mentioned in previous reviews) inpeccably clean! I couldn't find an inch of dust anywhere. They were also spacious. We had specifically asked for a high floor room, which I think in hindsight was a good move as we weren't disturbed by any of the traffic noise from outside. The only drawback was that due to the positioning of the room we didn't have a good view. So I would recommend requesting a high floor room with a view if you want one. It didn't bother us too much anyway as we were out and about most of the time. I have to mention the mini bar. I have been to many hotels where the mini bar prices are extortionate, but the prices in this hotel were very reasonable. I would probably steer clear of the white wine though which wasn't good at all. Unfortunately, I can't comment on the restaurant as my boyfriend and I ate out every night. However, the breakfast was pretty good, with plenty of choice. Location-wise, Barcelona is a pretty big plce, so like any big city, being located near a public transport hub is always a bonus. I would highly recommend the local Metro service for getting around Barcelona. There is a Metro stop about 8 mins walk from the hotel. You can buy a ticket for 8 Euros which provides you with 10 journeys. It's so much easier to use than the London underground too. For a three-star hotel, there's not a lot I can fault about this hotel. My only niggle would be the beds which were a little on the hard side but hotel beds tend to be this way. If I was returning to Barcelona I would definitley return to stay at the AB Viladomat.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable with Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: GreatPlaces2see
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights before and two nights after our cruise and were very pleased with the 2 rooms we stayed in. The rooms were more spacious than most European rooms, the beds were comfortable, the bathrooms were nice and clean and the hotel had a very friendly, helpful staff. The restaurant on the premises offers good food at reasonable prices. The train station and metro were several blocks away so if you're elderly like my husband and myself, it is easier to take a taxi to and from the airport and to the cruise terminals. We caught the hopon/hop off tourist bus at the train station and really enjoyed it, the tickets can be purchased in the train station. Also there are several ATM machines located near the hotel. We enjoyed walking around the neighborhood and stopping in some of the small shops. We would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel and does not justify low ranking”
Reviews.Author: cricketnut29
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Viladomat for 3 days at the end of May and can confirm that we experienced an excellent hotel that is modern and very spacious and clean and tidy. It may be slightly out of the way but is still only a 15 minute walk into La Ramblas or Placa Espanya at the other end. We caught the train into Placa Espanya where we walked to our hotel and from there we walked to our hotel within 20 minutes. Everything was ready for us when we arrived and service at reception was first class. We then had a few drinks at the bar where the excellent service was continued with John our bartender being brilliant. Dinner which we had at the hotel was also very good. We cannot understand the low ranking given this hotel which is certainly value for money and provides a safe warm and pleasant base for soemone visiting Barcelona. Our 3 days in Barcelona were comprised of spending one day up at Montserrat, and the rest of the time spent walking the streets of Barcelona and enjoying gthe Gaudi buildings and Las Ramblas and in particular Boqueria Markets which are always interesting to go to. We had some excitement in Placa Catalunya where there were demonstrations against the governments austerity measures which saw many placards and police ending with tear gas being used by the police and rubber bullets beign fired to disperse the crowd. We did not feel in any danger however and moved off to a bar close by to have a quiet drink. When leaving the hotel we walked up to Sepulveda and turned left to catch the Areobus. This was at 5.30am in the monring and we felt perfectly safe walking at that time of the monring dragging our suitacses to catch and Easy jet flight to Paris. T repeat the hotel is highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “A very good 3 star, could be a bit closer. Tube only 10 mins away and only £5 in a taxi to the ramblas”
Reviews.Author: Jarviejarv
Reviews.Content: A very good 3 star, could be a bit closer. Tube only 10 mins away and only £5 in a taxi to the ramblas. Did not have breakfast plenty of cafes around for a cheaper breakfast option.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, would recommend”
Reviews.Author: helenagee
Reviews.Content: the room was lovely, clean towels and cleaners came in everyday to make beds etc.. would recommend using the nearest station 'Entenca' to travel to landmarks as the sagrada familia was really far to walk to (we are both mid 20s and do lots of touristy walking holidays but found the map was a bit deceptive of distances) - would definitely recommend this hotel. friendly staff and comfortable rooms. our room was facing the main road but the traffic noise didnt affect us PS DO NOT use the barcelona tour buses which are £23 a day because for a one day unlimited travel card on the metro is £6 and has stops at every famous landmark and includes buses trams & trains.

Reviews.Title: “Good value hotel but noisy”
Reviews.Author: Mrsvark
Reviews.Content: Hotel was good value for the money we paid, however the walls were thin and you could hear people returning to their rooms at all hours of the morning, good location for Sants Station. We went to the Greek restaurant near to the hotel that was recommended on other posts but it was a bit disappointing, starter was good but main meal was returned because it was cold in the middle. Would return to this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Noisy!”
Reviews.Author: espeso
Reviews.Content: It's an ok hotel, but very noisy. When someone walked by the room, or in the room above, or shutting a window etc, the whole room shook. Got a cheap deal - about €60 per night without breakfast. A 20-25 min walk to pl. Catalunya

Reviews.Title: “Solid choice”
Reviews.Author: JLNairn0803
Reviews.Content: A friend and I stayed in this hotel for a long weekend visit to Barcelona. The room was VERY spacious, especially by European standards. It was absolutely spotless, and reasonably priced as well. We had a number of flight delays, so we arrived around 11pm but had no problems checking in. In fact, all of our interactions with the staff were extremely pleasant. There was a little grocery store across the street, so we were able to get a few staples for the room. The only "complaint" (if you can call it that) that we had was that it was a solid 20 minute walk to any metro station, and we had to switch metro lines at least once depending on where we were going. However we (2 females in our 20s) felt safe in the area (it was fairly residential). We would both stay in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: Jags51
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in AB Viladomat for two nights in the first week of Sept 10. We found the hotel comfortable although the rooms are slightly small but sufficient for two persons. The breakfast was sumptuous with a good variety and the chef organised an omlette for me even though it was not on the table. The staff is very friendly and the ones at the reception gave us a lot of information on sight-seeing. If you buy the hop-on hop-off bus (Bus Turistic) ticket at the hotel you save 2 euros on each ticket. The location is in a quiet locality and away from noise and crowd, but close enought to important destinations. You can walk down to Ramblas or the main train station in about 15 minutes. The only negative aspect of the hotel is the air-conditioning which was not cooling sufficiently - I mentioned this to the staff and they have promised to look into it.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, spacious, friendly neighbourhood”
Reviews.Author: Angela1Wales
Reviews.Content: The hotel is just a 10-minute walk from Rocafort metro - this takes you to the centre within 5-10 minutes. The hotel is very clean, comfortable and the staff are very friendly and helpful. My partner and I had a full day left in Barcelona on the day of check out, but the staff kept our bags locked up safe for us until we were ready to come back for them at around 7pm.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel But Not Central”
Reviews.Author: gazza353
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed here for a long weekend in Barcelona. The hotel is fine - very clean, modern, good quality etc. I think the hotel is used more as a 'business' hotel though, as the wardrobe space in the rooms is tiny, and defintely not enough if you are staying for more than just a couple of nights... The only negative is the location - it's not especially central and some of the streets in Barcelona can be pretty long when you're walking! The nearest metro is also a good 10 minute walk away, so take good shoes if you stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant staff and great value”
Reviews.Author: MonaClaremont_CA
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the AB Viladomat with friends both before and after our Mediterranean cruise. I had been here before with my late husband after we had a previous poor experience at the Hilton in Barcelona. This hotel had more amenities than the Hilton provided at our prior stay, and it still provides a hotel experience that more travelers from the USA would be familiar with and accustomed to - Wifi, multilanguage TV, toiletries, large bathrooms. The only downside that could be improved is that the air conditioning and electricity to the room are controlled by the room key card. The air did not cool down sufficiently, so we opened the room window in the evening to allow the room to cool down from breezes off the ocean. That made it a little noisy, but we managed. The breakfast buffet is quite plentiful by European standards. We had just come from a week in Paris where many of the North American and English breakfast items provided here were available at extra cost only. Rebecca, the Desk Clerk, deserves special mention. She is polite, organized, always courteous and helpful even when the desk gets rushed at check-in and check-out. The bar and dining staff are top-notch also. We did have problems with the desk clerk we encountered on July 2, 2010 who was supposed to see that we had a triple instead of a double room. It took 4 calls to the reception desk to get the extra bed and another 4 to get an extra towel set. We never did figure out what her delay was. It seemed she never followed through on requests, yet we saw her talking to other staff and not being particularly busy. Rebecca is a standout for customer service in any language however. One of the best lunches we ordered in Barcelona was at this hotel. It was prepared beautifully and presented well. No one rushes you at this hotel. Before we left, the young male desk clerk even provided us with a wake-up cup of coffee in the lobby. One downside for some: The mattresses in the rooms could be replaced soon. They have gone from firm to hard. I did not mind it as I like a very firm mattress; but my friends sure did. Walk around the neighborhood of this hotel. There are restuarants, shops and some of the nicest residents you will ever meet in Spain. The Greek restaurant around the corner to the left of the entrance was better than those we ate at in Athens!

Reviews.Title: “A good find if you don't mind a bit of a walk”
Reviews.Author: sopasopasopa
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights in this hotel and have no complains about their service, the room was nice and clean as was the bathroom, which was spacious. It's a 8 minute walk to the underground but the buses are closer. The staff was really nice and helpful. There was also a minibar in the room which had reasonable prices. It also had free wifi, but you need to ask the receptionist for the password. Overall a good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Dont expect too much!!”
Reviews.Author: Ropley
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a few days at the Viladomat. Hotel is described as a three star and standards wander between a two & a three. First the good points. It's reasonable value for an expensive city and with bus and train routes nearby every part of the city is accessable. We visited Barcelona for the Nou camp and with teenage boys it was ideal for that. Walk 5-10 mins to Entenca station and four stops later you are at Collblanc for the Nou camp. This is also not a bad metro station to use from the airport as from there to the hotel it's down hill. Worth considering with bags etc!! Reception areas and bar/restaurant were nice enough. The rooms however are looking a little tired. The door frame was showing signs of damp and coming away from the wall (room 101 - triple). Areas of the bath had slight mould growth. The biggest problem with this room however was the fact that the hotel wont put the air con until until end of May and do not have any fans as an alternative. If you open the window expect sleepless nights due to traffic noise below. It was easter weekend and this part of Barcelona was like a ghost town. However the traffic still woke us up!! If you do stay here the greek restaurant a few doors down from the hotel on Avda roma (Dionisus) is very good and reasonably priced. The staff there are also great and it will still be open when you get back from the Nou camp or city centre. Otherwise the area has little to offer, but for seasoned travellers or those who dont mind the buses and metro it wont be an issue. The 10 trip metro ticket can be used by multiple people. Just remember to stamp it for each person on every trip on buses/metro. Bus 46 from terminal two at the airport will take you to Plaza Espanya for about 1.42 euros. Airport bus will cost about 3.50. If you have a book of 10 tickets from Playa Espanya to the airport on bus 46 will cost you 78 cents (bargain).

Reviews.Title: “not particularly romantic but good value for money”
Reviews.Author: beejayrox
Reviews.Content: The hotel is not particularly plush or romantic but services are ok inline with the reasonable room rate. Room was very clean and there is no street noise. We felt safe in the hotel and in the area - the location was ok, 15 minute walk to Rocafort Metro, from there it is easy to connect to Espanya or Catalunya and get to anywhere fast. The breakfast was very good; reception staff are helpful and friendly and speak English well (from what I read of other hotels this is quite rare in Barca); I had been feeling unwell and spent one day in bed and the girl at reception asked me the next day whether I was feeling better which was very thoughtful. My initial disappointment with the small size of the bedroom and hard beds (an extra pillow would have been nice!) was overcome by the good attentive service in the lobby and restaurant. AB Viladomat is a good mid-price functional hotel for a visit to Barcelona, however for a romantic weekend perhaps book in somwhere more upmarket. ps. get tickets to go and see Barcalona FC play if you can, it's amazing!

Reviews.Title: “Ask for the window”
Reviews.Author: worldIsee
Reviews.Content: Overall the hotel was decent, nothing special but no acute problems. The thing that absolutely stunned us was lack of the window in the room. Well, there was one, it was tiny, about 15 inches wide, opened only slightly and it faced a wall about 2 feet away where some unlucky creatures like us had their room. Would not complain if they have ever offered us a choice. Especially that it wasn't as cheap as it is now. So, our advice, ask for the window unless of course you are enjoying the perpetual gloom. Room was tiny, safe deposit box could be opened by turning the lock around because it was loose but the bathroom was clean enough although slightly on the long time used never updated side. Definitely not 3 star hotel as they advertise themselves. Didn't have many encounters with hotel staff but things were smooth at the checking in and out. They have let us to leave the luggage for a couple of hours after checking out which was handy. Finding a luggage storage facility that works and is safe proved something of a task on a previous trip. We wouldn't recommend that hotel to anybody who hasn't been in Barcelona before. It is a good walk to the city center and there is not much around worth of seeing. If you have been in Barcelona before you might appreciate a nice morning stroll (about 20 minutes) through the parts of the city that are not invaded by tourists yet.

Reviews.Title: “Good all rounder at a reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: thecoaster
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 4 nights Feb/ March 2010. Overall, the hotel is a good choice for a mid range/ mid price hotel for general sightseeing in Barcelona. Likes: -We had a corner room on the top floor (7th) which was very spacious, with a vast amount of window space. It was possible to see Tibidabo in one direction and the Sagrada Familia in the distance in the other direction. -The bed was massive and comfortable. -The location was 15 mins walk from Catalunya Sq, 10 mins from Sants rail station and 10 mins from Espania rail station. It you want a central base to see most of the sights in Barcelona its a good spot. -Price, booked in advance for £44 per night for the room No negatives other than despite double glazing the windows did let in a slight noise in the morning when rush hour was on. Would I recommend the AB Viladomat or stay there again... yes.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Great Location, Superb Breakfast, Clean and Functional”
Reviews.Author: spanglything
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights over Xmas including Xmas day. We found the hotel to be in a great area for getting to all the major sights. We walked everywhere, so this may not be as great for older travellers or people not able to walk far, but we loved it. The room was spotless and had a nice bathroom with great shower. Towels changed daily and sheets changed once in four days, which we thought was good. The room was quite small, but perfectly ok for us. There is a mini bar which wasn't too over priced, we used it to store water and milk. There are no tea or coffee making facilities in the room, so we took a travel kettle. There is air con and heating in the rooms, but the air con didn't work in our room and blew out hot air. It wasn't too bad as we opened a window, but this does let in traffic noise, so be warned if you were to stay here in summer it would be unbearable! The road outside is busy and therefore noisy, but the double glazing does keep out most of the noise. Staff were polite and efficient without being over the top. When we booked we paid a little extra for breakfast, it was SO worth it. Be advised to do this, as to book breakfast once at the hotel would be 15Euros which is very expensive. The breakfast was so good it set us up for the day every day, without the need to eat again until evening. The hotel is functional and clean, but does lack a little personality, they didn't even decorate inside for xmas day, nothing on the tables. BUT as a base for seeing everything it was excellent and I would stay here again. We were out all day everyday anyway so weren't too bothered for home comforts. We paid £280 for four nights B&B over Xmas for tow of us. Which all in all I think was excellent value, we were very happy.

Reviews.Title: “Good trip”
Reviews.Author: TrionaM
Reviews.Content: Average hotel, fairly easy acces to city centre via subway.

Reviews.Title: “A bit disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Duke_Maverick
Reviews.Content: Hotel AB Viladomat seemed great on paper to us, as it was cheap enough, the pics looked nice and when we arrived we were greeted in english by very friendly staff. However we were not told at check in that breakfast would be the only meal served the whole time of our stay, as the kitchen and bar were closed in August. Also they didn't appreciate us bringing in our own food and drink, when I asked at reception for a corkscrew, his english seemed to escape him, but luckily enough I speak spanish, so it was a chore for a bottle oif wine to be opened, or so it seemed! The rooms were nice but nothing special. When we complained afterwards the hotel didn't want to know, it was as if they were saying, we have your money, we want nothing more to do with you! So I would not recommend this hotel nor would I stay in it again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and staff but loacation not the most convenient.”
Reviews.Author: MJ72508
Reviews.Content: We stayed AB Vilodomat for 4 nights in August. It took about 10 minutes to get to the nearest train station from the airport and another 10-15 minutes dragging our suitcases to the hotel. I would do it again to save on the taxi cab fare though. The Hotel staff here was better than some of the nicer ones in the US. The room was a great size and the tourist attraction book in the room (which we found 2 days in) is a great source of info for prices, transit, and food options in the city. After reading reviews about the breakfast in the hotel we chose a ton of other options on the way to the metro each morning. The only reason I wouldn't recommend this hotel to everyone is the distance from the city center and mass transit options. The walk is certainly a good one (20 min to Las Ramblas area and about 10-15 to the nearest metro stop). Coming from a walking city it was fine for us, but I think next time we return to Barcelona the convenience of a closer hotel is worth a little more of a splurge. Sightseeing: We took the highly recommended open top bus tour, and it was a great way to get an overview of Barcelona. Park Guiell is a great trip. Pack some snacks and drinks and check it out, it is a little bit of a walk from the metro (it is up a hill) but well worth it if you love architecture. The Sagrada Familia is a must see and if only one elevator to the top is operating when you go (like us), wait in that line before touring the lower grounds and the museum. The views from the towers are amazing and if you have a translation headset you can listen to the information while you are in line. You can see most of the interior from the elevator line (directly to the right as you go through the main entrance) We took a day trip to Monserrat, Torres Winery, and Sitges, and if you chose a day trip overview I would pick this excursion. It was amazing and if I had more time I would return to Sitges or Monserrat for an entire day trip rather than having to leave for the next site.

Reviews.Title: “A nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: AjutoruldeCalatorie
Reviews.Content: Me and my girlfriend stayed here at the beginning of September 2009. The room was very spacious same the bathroom, the furniture ok. The breakfast worth the money, a good diversity of hot and cold food. The location of hotel is ok, about 5 minutes of walk to the nearest metro station and about 20 min from Catalunya Plaza. We didn't tried the restaurant but we found a very nice Greek one, at 20 meters from hotel on Avinguda de Roma

Reviews.Title: “We Were Bumped To Another Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BobSakamanoMB
Reviews.Content: When we arrived at the hotel, the staff manager said that they had given our room to other guests as a group had arrived. I had looked online for a great hotel and picked AB Viladomat for many reasons. I booked my room via booking.com a month earlier. I explained how I was not impressed at all with being bumped to another 3 star hotel. I asked management to provide a free breakfast or discount for the inconvenience and they told me no. All they would do is pay for my taxi to the other hotel. After my holidays, I emailed the manager telling her how we were not impressed, and she apologized. Why would you want to stay at a hotel where you are treated like this?

Reviews.Title: “Nice, Clean Hotel - Not far from the Airport, although a bit of a walk into the City Centre”
Reviews.Author: ScottLisey
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at the AB Vilodomat for 3 nights in July 2009. By taxi, it takes around 20 minutes to get to the Hotel, which costs approximately 20-25 Euros. For those not not used to visiting Spanish cities, it's worth bearing in mind that taxis from the Airport (to any location) charge a supplement of around 5 Euros (in addition to the fare that shows on the meter). Hotel staff appeared very attentive and the double room with which we were provided was very clean and kept to a good standard. The mini bar is also reasonably priced, although the snacks are priced a little excessively. On that note, the price of a breakfast is also rather excessive; the cost for a continental breakfast is 12.50 Euros, whereas the cost for an "English" breakfast is £ 15.00 Euros (you can eat breakfast for less than half the price at one of the tapas restaurants in the City Centre). You can either settle the bill following the breakfast or wait until you check-out / leave the hotel. On the first morning, my partner did not have any breakfast and, instead, made do with a coffee. On receiving the bill once we'd finished, the restuarant staff attempted to charge us for two continental breakfasts (a total of 25.00 Euros), despite the fact that my partner had only helped herself to a coffee. Whilst the restuarant staff were happy to adjust the bill to reflect one breakfast and a coffee, I would recommend that you check each and every bill to satisfy yourself of the charge that you're likely to receive when checking-out. As regards the hotel's location, it's approximately a 2.5km walk to the City Centre (i.e. the Cathedral, Gaudi Museum, etc) which, if done on a regular basis, makes for good exercise! If you not one for walking, taxis are always available (the taxis in Barcelona are coloured in black and yellow), although to avoid constant taxi fares, it might make better sense to stay in a more central location. One recommendation would be the open top bus tour, which costs approximately 21 Euros for an adult ticket (lasting for a day). This is a great way to see Barcelona and some of the main sights if you're only visting for a few days and, thus, are limited for time. The Sagrada Familia is a must see, but can get very crowded during peak season. Overall, the AB Vilodomat is a good hotel; clean with no thrills. More generally, Barcelona is a fantastic city that we'll visit time and time again. If you're into arcitecture and art, then Barcelona is the place for you!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel but nothing special”
Reviews.Author: voden23
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here as part of our European vacation. The hotel is six blocks from the nearest metro station which means you can get anywhere in the city relatively quickly. It is located in a nice neighborhood. It is a business oriented hotel and offers room service and free internet. I would not call it high speed though. There is a breakfast buffet that is exceptional, but it costs 12 euro and they do not have that posted anywhere but once you sit down and eat they give you a nice bill. If you do not want the buffet there is a grocery store across the street where you can get juice and pastries/yogurt on the cheap and store in the minibar fridge in the room. The bathroom was very nice and clean and the room was spacious. At the time we stayed there was construction going on on the street below so sleeping in was a bit difficult. The staff speaks reasonable English so that is not an issue. We would stay there again if we went back for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Fink1983
Reviews.Content: Very good hotel, in a reasonable location. 20m walk to the Ramblas. Location very quiet and peaceful. Back again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Service”
Reviews.Author: ozzie55
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel in March 2009 with my girlfriend. Its a great hotel for a 3 star! really nice inside. The service was great with really friendly staff! The room was spacious, clean and was very secure! Location was also brilliant with only a 20 minute walk to the center of Barcelona! The only problem we had was that there was road works going on just outside the hotel we never had a problem with noise though when we were in our room and that was overlooking the roadworks! There is plenty to do over there, we visited many of Gaudi's buildings and went to the Ramblas. Also try and go to the markets just off the Ramblas the fruit is beautifully stacked! We also went to Camp Nou (Barcelona FC) The bus tour is really worth doing in Barcelona because you can hop on and off the bus as you please and the buses arrive every ten minutes!!! I would definitely go again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Marrgot
Reviews.Content: Everything was great: the location was good, room very clean, excellent breakfast. The room was worm and spacious, there were several supermarkets near by. The wireless internet connection was good, we had no problems with it.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value Hotel in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: LondonKymani
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the AB Viladomat in March for my sisters birthday, our main criteria was a hotel within reasonable distance to the architecture and museums we wanted to visit in Barcelona. This hotel was really good value averaging £40-£45 per night for a double/twin room. Rooms were of a good size, as were the bathrooms and were clean and comfortable. Our rooms were looking out to the main road, Avenguida de Roma, but with the windows closed the rooms were fairly quiet and we werent disturbed, despite unattractive building developments going on directly outside. The first day we walked to the Placya de Catalunya and Las Ramblas but must admit this was a 20-30 minute walk and we did use taxis quite often, saying that the taxis are cheap and it didnt cost more than 5-8 euros to get to and from the hotel, the same hotel nearer the tourist centre would have been much more expensive and therefore this still proved more cost effective. I would recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Barcelona who do not want to pay over inflated rates for hotels in the main tourist strip of Las Ramblas and who dont mind being a bit further out of the main centre, Barcelona is a large city and the sights are spread out, so being out of the tourist strip wasnt a problem. On another note try restaurants out of the main tourist area as well, overall we found a better quality of service and food, and better value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel & Great Price for Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: khellings
Reviews.Content: Hi, Visited in Aug 06 to celebrate my 18th birthday. Great city loved Barcelona. Hotel is a bit far out we walked in to placa cataluyna would say it took 20mins plus. Would highly recommend the tourist bus, really wanted to go on the night time one where the monuments/fountains are lit up but this was only running on days we weren't there which was a shame. Hotel room wasn't very big but it was a city break and we were off exploring.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: donna_da1
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week in September 2007 and thought it was a great hotel. The front desk staff were really nice, very helpful, the room was lovely very spacious and very well kept we definatley got a bargin with this hotel. After check in when we went up to our room to discover none of the lights worked, the staff were very apolgetic and moved us immediatly. The only downside was that it was a little out of the way but it was no major problem the metro is only a five minite walk away and then you can get to anywhere in the city. The main train station is also only a 10 minite walk and theres a train which runs reguarly between the station and the airport. Our room didnt include breakfast but we found a little supermarket opposite the hotel where we could get croissants and fruit for breakfast and big bottles of water which was great to have on you while sight seeing in the heat. There's a lot of venders selling drinks near the tourists spots but the prices are a rip off much better to have your own!

Reviews.Title: “Very expensive breakfast! OK hotel.”
Reviews.Author: roobieroo
Reviews.Content: This was an OK place to stay. You can really smell smoke in the hallways so I guess that non smoking is based on a per room basis and not by floor. Wireless internet generally didn't work at all and when it did it was painfully slow. The room itself was nice even if a bit on the small side. Beware of breakfast. I guess I wasn't really paying attention but it's not included in the price of the room and is about 13 euros per person. The location is good if you don't mind a bit of a walk to get to most of the Barcelona attractions. It's also not that far of a walk to the metro lines but I probably wouldn't recommend it for people who have trouble walking. Hopefully my internet related issues were a fluke since it's hard to imagine things being that bad all the time. The front desk staff had no problem speaking English and were very helpful with directions. If I were to go back to Barcelona I'd probably try and find another place but I wouldn't be upset if this were the only place I could get a room.

Reviews.Title: “Ecxellent Hotel - Great value and location!”
Reviews.Author: tim2788
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hotel Viladomat with my girlfriend in September 2008. I Paid 80€ per night for a double room, which was excellent value! Location The hotel is situated on Avignue de Roma, 3 blocks away from the Metro stations Urgel and Rocafort. This takes about 5/7 mins to walk and is in a residential neighborhood where I felt completely safe. There is a cashpoint across the road and plenty of cafes and restaurants where you can sit outside and have a drink. Taxi's are cheap an plentiful and always run past the hotel anytime of day, we either asked the reception to phone one which was always efficient or hailed them from the street. A taxi will cost around 6€ to plaza catalunya. Rooms We stayed in room 107 on the first floor which had a view about 20ft above street level, the view was interesting as we could watch the action on the street from our room. The bed was a double bed (not two single ones pushed together!) which was a pleasant surprise! The room was quite large by European standards and was incredibly clean. The safe is available for hire for price of 10€ which is well worth it to keep all belongings in. Now for the best feature, the mini bar! The mini bar was extremely good value which is a rare occurrence! Beers and Soft Drinks were around 1.40€ which was a relief as it meant we never had to keep going to supermarkets! The bathroom was clean and had complimentary toiletries. All in all this hotel offered an excellent base for exploring Barcelona. The hotel is not centrally located but this makes it all the more fun! The prices are spot on in my opinion and I would not hesitate in using this hotel when I visit Barcelona again!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel For Families And For Pre Cruise”
Reviews.Author: VAKILAT
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 2 nights in August before our cruise. We had booked two interconnecting rooms months in advance for the 4 of us. Booking was very fast and easy. Quick responses were recd to our e-mails and each time we asked a question a polite reply was given . I recommended the hotel to all my friends who were going on the cruise and in total 5 families ended staying at the hotel pre cruise. Rooms were excellent. Altho interconnecting, both rooms led to a small hallway which had its own door. It became like a little flat of your own. Breakfast was good too. Its very good value for money but only if you book it in advance as its half price otherwise you pay something like 12 euros. Its about 10 mins walk to the metro. Staff helpful but could do with a bit more smiling. if you get there very late at night there isn't much to eat altho you can help yourself to a free cup of strong coffee and free pastries downstairs . There is a supermarket across the road for your water etc; Downside is the road building noise which starts in the morning but otherwise a superb hotel . I think it is better than a 3 star. Beware of the taxi drivers as they charged me an exhorbitant 35 euros to get to the port. It should be no more than about 25 euros for 4 passengers and 4 luggage!!The rate for this hotel compared to other 3* is less yet overall it is better than a 3 star.I would add that all my other friends had nothing bad to say about the hotel. After the cruise we paid more and stayed at a 4* but wish had stayed at VIladomat!!

Reviews.Title: “good for families”
Reviews.Author: cdcdcd
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a night with 2 children. The hotel gave us 2 large adjoining rooms on request for the price of a family room. We booked a car parking space - there is no parking at the hotel. The hotel was clean, breakfast not included. Its within easy reach of the metro, and within walking distance of the Eixample area with the Gaudi buidings - aprox 10 minutes walk.

Reviews.Title: “Near Gay area and very reasonably priced”
Reviews.Author: Alexander M
Reviews.Content: Stayed here together with my boyfriend in this nice 3* Hotel during the end of August 2007. We wanted to stay close to the gay area in the Eixsample part of town. Hotel rooms are very spacious, nice marble bathrooms, comfy beds. friendly but not very enthousiastic employees and a very nice breakfast (not inclusive) only minus: we tried to watch a movie via pay tv but it didn't work.

Reviews.Title: “Yes, I would go back”
Reviews.Author: holilyday
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel recently and found it to be very good value for money. It's very, very clean and comfortable and served a good varied buffet breakfast. The rooms are comfortable and I found the staff to be most helpful. Yes, there was a lot of roadwork noise outside which started early in the morning but this didn't bother us as we went to Barcelona to see the sights and experience the culture, rather than spend time in the hotel. If you want a good clean base for your trip to Barcelona then look no further.

Reviews.Title: “A quiet corner with a mediterranean Flavour (NOT!)”
Reviews.Author: West1700
Reviews.Content: The hotel was nice enough and very much as described, the rooms were pleasant and very clean, the breakfast was varied and substantial and the staff were OK if not overly helpful. However there was major construction work going on outside which involved pile drivers and pneumatic drills (Jack hammers) which started at 0730 in the morning for six days a week (we were only there from Thursday to Monday but the only respite was on Sunday). This would appear to be a major development and I would assume will be continuing for many months to come, I feel that although outside their control it was dishonest not to inform potential guess of the disruption they will encounter. In summary although I would have no hesitation in recommending the hotel without the construction works, in the current situation it was not the restful weekend break that we were looking for & if you are looking for a lie in or relaxing in the afternoon reading in your room look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, not so good location”
Reviews.Author: NorwegianGunner
Reviews.Content: Was staying at this hotel for 5 nights and I had a very good stay, I must say. The room itself was big and had alot of space. Free internet is also a plus. You can also use the safe in your room for 10 euros in deposit. The toilet was good and so were the shower. The service in the reception was also great. Went down to the reception to get an extra towel, and they sent me the towel up to the room 10 minutes later. The only negative thing with this hotel is the location. You have to walk about ten minutes to the closest underground station Urgell. The Barcelona Sants station is about 15 mins walk.

Reviews.Title: “Below average”
Reviews.Author: Blueram
Reviews.Content: An average hotel with a 15-20 minute walk to the Guadi attractions in town. Positives • Clean relatively dated room • Good English used Negatives • Distance to the centre of town • Front desk were not willing to provide a lock for the room safe and told me that I need to provide them with my valuables to be kept in a drawer. When I said that would not be acceptable to the Manager they relented – Very strange • Front desk suggested a local taxi driver that added another 10 Euro to the meter to take us to the airport – really soured our impression of the hotel staff. I would most likely look for other accommodation on my next visit to Barcelona

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value for money!”
Reviews.Author: kerryaa
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights recently- Nothing but good things to say! What you get for the price you pay is really good, Bathroom and bedroom very well kept and spotlessly clean! Mini Bar is very well priced and offers a wide range. Location is good also, about 5 mins away from the nearest Metro. Reception were really friendly and helpful, always on hand if you need them. Overall it was a great stay and id definatly stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable value for money”
Reviews.Author: marvieBedford
Reviews.Content: Booked through Lastminute.com after reading some reviews of the property which were generally good - had a pretty limited budget so knew it wouldn't be anything spectacular. The location was four blocks down and two across to the nearest Metro and then two stops to Placa Catalunya, so not desperately far out and we actually walked from hotel to Casa Mila (La Pedrera) (15 mins in a direct line) and then onto Sagrada Familia - it looks like a long way to the latter on maps but its not really! The room was spacious and spotlessly clean BUT there were no tea or coffee making facilities (i've never found that missing before in a hotel so it was sorely missed!) - however we just adapted to wandering to a local pavement cafe & watching the world go by, so it wasn't too much of an issue. The traffic is quite heavy but being exhausted from sightseeing and numbed by a few drinks(!), we slept through that - The main problem was the road was being dug up Right Outside Our Window all weekend, so a jolly JCB alarm call at 8a.m. every day! Can hardly blame the hotel for that though. The staff were very helpful, storing our bags for us and calling us a super-quick cab to the airport, and getting tea/coffee from the bar was actually surprisingly reasonable in cost - i was expecting a fleecing but it was only a couple of euros. Overall, it was a Ronseal Hotel - it did what it said on the tin!

Reviews.Title: “great hotel/bad location”
Reviews.Author: parishoes
Reviews.Content: I came here as the group leader for a high school trip to Barcelona. The hotel exceeded my expectations. For instance, the rooms were spacious (I was in a triple), comfortable, and clean. I had no trouble with noise, as other reviewers did, but perhaps that was because I was exhausted from the pace and demands of leading a student group! Others in my party (adult chaperones) did complain about noise. Breakfast was excellent, of a wide variety of food choices-- all fresh. The restaurant was very good for other meals, too. The bar area was too public, though. Like others, I, too, found the distance from main attractions long. This is probably my only real complaint about the hotel. That said, however, the neighborhood was safe and clean. I was pleased. I'd like to say something about the staff at the desk. They were top notch! One of my students had a medical emergency while we were out and about, and when I returned to the hotel with the group (while my colleague went to the emergency room with the student), they were quick to pass phone calls to me. They allowed me to use the phone at the desk, and did all they could to help facilitate the myriad of calls I had to take and make (even those to the states). They made a difficult situation go as smoothly as possible.

Reviews.Title: “Things you might want to know......”
Reviews.Author: UkMiranda
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for three nights. It is important that if you are a light sleeper or unused to heavy traffic going passed in the night that you request a room that is at the back of the hotel. Our first night felt like torture. The following morning we asked if we could change and we were offered a room that was only doors away from the original one but was so much quieter it was unbelievable. Breakfast was excellent. A choice of hot food, breads, meats, cheeses, cake, fruit, cereal, juices, and even champagne! Staff on the whole were very helpful, and the rooms were very clean with tv and minibar. (How I wished there was coffeee in the rooms but I am unsure if the Spanish do this). The worst part for us was the distance to the nearest tube....about a ten minute walk...which does not sound much but after walking all day it felt a chore. Looking back I have learned that although I enjoyed my stay here, I would now look for something more central in a quieter street.

Reviews.Title: “Exactly what we expected, in a good way”
Reviews.Author: Ellie11
Reviews.Content: We struggled to find accommodation during the height of the Febuary 2008 world mobile conference - we were travelling for leisure - and settled on AB Viladomat. As the previous reviewer said, the hotel won't let you down. It is a high standard 3 star hotel; clean with friendly, helpful staff, cheap minibar, good hairdryer and situated in a pleasant residential area. Our room looked out on to a busy intersection but the traffic noise didn't bother us. Our room was not huge but bigger than on our previous stay in a 4 star Barcelona hotel. Only negative would be the distance from the city centre. The 5 to 10 minute walk from the hotel to the nearest station, Rocafort, on the L1 underground line is pleasant but it can take almost another 20 mins to get to Las Ramblas - depending on underground connections. Taxi from Pl. Catalunya to hotel was a reasonable €5. Didn't eat breakfast as there were many cheaper options nearby. Staff kept our luggage for a few hours on check out day without any problem.

Reviews.Title: “48 hours in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: doonhammer
Reviews.Content: Hi , Just returned from flying 48 hours to Barcelona, where we stayed at the AB Viladomat in Barcelona. We booked this through last minute and got our flights and hotel for good price. The hotel does exactly what it says on the tin! Its clean, modern and a good 20 minute walk from La Ramblas. If you want something in the midst of all the action, then this is not the hotel for you, but if you are looking for a nice , clean hotel to lay your head after a busy day sightseeing without breaking the bank, then this fit the deal. Mini bar prices were resonable, as were the bar prices. Breakfast, although very nice, was a bit pricey, it is much better to take a short stroll and have breakfast in one of the small street cafes nearby. All in all , I would recommend this hotel, but if you want to be close to the action, then not the one for you.

Reviews.Title: “Location great, hotel wasn't.”
Reviews.Author: SomeGoddess
Reviews.Content: I went away to Barcelona for a week with my partner. On first impressions, the hotel looks good. The bus from the airport drops you down the road (which we only realised when we saw it go past - after we walked for about 15mins). I had booked a double room - but got a twin room. I went down to reception to ask to be moved (only because this had been a surprise birthday trip for my partner) but they said they were too busy and couldn't do anything. But my partner was fine with it - so it was ok. Staff were ok - most mornings the cleaner would just walk into our rooms without knocking - which got annoying after 3 days as it was always around 8-9a.m. We mentioned it at reception - and she never bothered us again. The hotel is noisy and if your a light sleeper don't stay here - luckily I had read previous reviews so took some ear plugs - however, it didnt help. Breakfast was not great at all - dishes that we picked up always had food stuck to it - was not impressed. And this seemed to happen throughout the whole week we were there. Location, however, was good. I prefer not to stay in the city, but slightly out of it and this hotel was convienant. However, me and my partner have decided that when we go back to Barcelona - we will stay somewhere a little bit closer to the city - as at night times we had to make sure we didnt get the metro back so late as the area around the hotel did get a bit dead. We loved Barcelona, but sadly the hotel was not for us. Will def. go back to Barcelona soon - we felt a week was not enough for us.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Service, very Reasonable”
Reviews.Author: dirtrider775
Reviews.Content: Nice modern hotel, the staff was freindly from the top down, Room Service even remembered that i like a pot ot hot water for my tea the next morning. Although there is no wow factor here, AB Viladomat dose have everything that you need in a full service hotel. The hotel is located about 4 blocks in either direction to a metro station, so although not as convenient, its not a bad walk. The area has the feel of a middle class neighborhood. Safe to walk at any hour. Just be careful when walking, seems like people in Barcelona do not like picking up after thier dogs.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel in a handy location”
Reviews.Author: carolwesterly
Reviews.Content: After researching the internet and reading reports on TripAdvisor I booked this hotel for 3 couples traveling together on a cruise from Barcelona - we stayed for 2 nights prior to the cruise. I contacted the hotel directly by email to make the reservation. We were very pleased with the hotel - the rooms were spacious, clean and in a great location. The bathrooms were very large and contained a full-size tub and shower. By booking the breakfast along with the room, we were charged $6.50 Euro which is half the normal price if you don't pre-book. The breakfast was well worth it - a great variety of hot and cold foods in a nice dining room. We were within walking distance of many attractions, including the turistic bus which is definitely worth doing for anyone's first visit to Barcelona. A grocery store was directly across the street which was convenient for buying bottled water, sodas and ice cream sandwiches.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: EncantaEspana
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the AB Viladomat in Sept 2007. It was great to stay in a hotel with very friendly and helpful staff, exceptionally cleaned rooms/surroundings and modern, tasteful decor. We also enjoyed the food offered for breakfast, which was of a continental nature. The meats and cheese offered was of a higher standard than what you usually find in Spanish hotels - particularly those in tourist areas.

Reviews.Title: “We'd stay again”
Reviews.Author: benjamin7
Reviews.Content: Stayed with friends for 3 nights in December. Hotel clean and well appointed. Staff friendly and helpful. Good value continental breakfast with plenty of choice although dinner options and service more limited, and pricier - better to try the Zenith hotel, one block west and one north. About 25 minutes walk from Plaza Catalunya but reliable bus service almost outside the door. We experienced some noise from a birthday nearby but it was no trouble for the manager to arrange another room for my wife and I to spend the night. We would go again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: MTreacy
Reviews.Content: Just back from a weekend break in this lovely hotel. Room was simple but nice and clean. Had no trouble with air conditioning or noise. Shower was brilliant. The only problem with the room was the view, or lack thereof! Our room was at the back of the hotel so the view was of some flats and a crane. But we had more important things to do in the city than stare out the window all day! Got a taxi from the bus station right to the door and had no trouble finding the place at all. Check in was smooth and fast, lovely gentleman behind the desk gave us loads of maps and lots of info. The other 2 female receptionists were a bit short with us and surly overall but perhaps we caught them on a bad weekend. Urgell metro station was a short walk away, felt very safe walking around the area. Placa Espanya was a lovely stroll down the road. We had breakfast one day (it wasnt included in the price). It was nice enough, a bit pricey though at €12.50 each. Overall I'd recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Hot and stuffy”
Reviews.Author: JenBelfast
Reviews.Content: We're just back from our stay at this hotel - 5 nights in late October/early November 2007. The hotel is OK - it's in a good location and not too expensive. Our major problem was the temperature in the room. When we arrived it was very warm but the heating was on. We fiddled about with the heating system a bit but couldn't make it any cooler so we turned it off. We spoke to reception about it and were told that all we could do was turn off the heating and open a window. They do not have air condtioning at this time of year. We left the window open for the rest of our stay but it just did not get any cooler. The temperature outside was sunny during the day (15 - 20 degrees C) and a bit chilly at night so I don't know where the heat was coming from - perhaps our room was beside a boiler or something, but nobody offered us a change of room. We were sleeping without any sheets, but still my husband couldn't sleep because of the stuffy heat, and I couldn't sleep because of the traffic noise with the window open! Barcelona itself is fantastic and I would highly recommend a trip there, but I wouldn't recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Geat hotel, iffy internet”
Reviews.Author: Waidesworld
Reviews.Content: Booked the hotel through Booking.com which gave us directions to within a few blocks, not fun. We didn't blame the hotel and they were very nice when we entered. Room was overpowering with a lemon scent when we entered but it soon dissipated. I think the maid service was a bit flamboyant with their sprays. Anyway, great shower (very important) and very clean room. Bed was comfortable. Our only issue was that we were on the seventh floor beside the service elevator which seemed to run all night. Parking was in the basement (room for about seven cars) and cost 15 euros a night. About a ten minute walk to the nearest tourist bus ( must!!) for tripping around the city. Neighborhood felt very safe when walking it at night and plenty of good restaurants around. The internet wireless connection was a bit dodgy. I had full signal but some sites like Yahoo.com and Boston.com were blocked for some reason and there was no help in sight. Still, I wasn't in Barcelona to se how life was at home so no big deal.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Base For Short Break To Barcelona!!”
Reviews.Author: SMC1Cheshire
Reviews.Content: This is a very good hotel , well worth 3*, and makes a good base for a short break to Barcelona.Taxi to hotel 20 euro, urgell metro 5mins walk, however pleasant walk to catalunya sq/las ramblas in 15-20mins. Check in and out friendly and efficient, hotel room spotlessly clean and modern. Breakfast at hotel 12-15euros, but lots of cafes for coffee and croissants for a quarter this price. Meat, cheese, bread and fresh fruit excellent value and quality in market off la ramblas. Supermarket opposite hotel for cheap alcohol(mini bar in room also reasonable for emergencies!!)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay at Viladomat”
Reviews.Author: rgc_scot
Reviews.Content: Booked a break at short notice and was persuaded by the reviews of Viladomat and we weren't disapointed! A short cab ride (about 20 euro) from the airport, the check-in was fast and friendly. the room was a good size and spotless. Only downside was the lack of a view, but that didn't really matter. The staff were always friendly and helpful. Hotel is nicely located in a quiter bit of the city within a 10 min stroll of 3 metro stations. \in the evening after a 'few' sangrias we would get a taxi back which normally cost about 5 euro. There was always a great selection at breakfast, even if you came down a bit late! This was our 1st trip to Barcelona and we had a great time and wouldn't hesitate to recomend the Viladomat to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Very good value for money”
Reviews.Author: MrJan
Reviews.Content: A very good hotel for the price we paid. Clean, friendly staff (save for the girl when we checked out) and comfortable rooms with just enough space for everything needed. The bathroom was excellent and supplied with everything you could possibly need. Shampoo and soap was refilled when needed. Location is good, about a 10-15 minutes brisk walk away from the centre of town. And about 5 minutes away is the closest underground station. As the hotel is situated on a quite busy street, there can be some outside noise from the traffic. But it didn't bother us at all since the windows shut almost every sound out and the room was efficiently air conditioned (no need to open any window). As with many hotels though, we could have wished for a few more coathangers, but that no big problem ;D.

Reviews.Title: “An overall good experience”
Reviews.Author: ilantlv
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in a quiet area, not very close to center but transportation is relatively easy with metro nearby. We were very disappointed that breakfast was not included and the expensive price of breakfast didnt make it worth taking on the spot. Room was pleasant - pretty spacious and felt new and clean. The value for money was satisfactory.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic! Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: browz1
Reviews.Content: Wow! Loved this hotel. From the moment we got there the staff were friendly, helpful and efficient. The rooms were clean, roomy and fantastic value. The hotel is a little out of the way but taxis to the very centre cost around 6 euros (£4) and as one taxi driver told us - 'it's better for sleeping than the Ritz' - 'cause we experinced hardly any noise. I cannot reccommend this hotel highly enough - it is fabulous! Everything a hotel should be and more. Check out the mini bar prices - all around £1 for most alcoholic drinks etc. Would definately stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: kevinpng
Reviews.Content: This is a good hotel at a very reasonable price in Barcelona. The room was big, modern and well maintained. The location is good and in easy walking distance of Rambla and other attractions. Close to three metros if you want to travel further. My only problem was at checkin when the reception clark tried to say that a double room was not available. She initially advised that I would have to take a room with two single beds. I questioned why as I had a confirmed booking for a room with a Queen Bed. She advised that bed preference was not guaranteed. However, after some debate she "found" a queen room and checked me in. Other than that, hotel is good value for Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Buddhawise
Reviews.Content: Spent a week at the AB Viladomat. A very good, clean and friendly hotel. Despite other reviews to the contrary, there are plenty of restaurants nearby (within 5-10mins) and the reception will even recommend one if you want. The hotel is in a good location and if you don't mind walking you can get to the centre of Barcelona within 20-25 mins. If not take the metro (Rocafort approx 6 blocks away) and get there quicker. If you are going to spend more than a few days in Barcelona, I recommend that you buy a Barcelona card. It's cheap and gives you loads of discounts at museums, restaurants etc. Barcelona is a BEAUTFUL city. If you love art, architecture, shopping and eating, you will be in your element!

Reviews.Title: “looking forward to return next year”
Reviews.Author: colin_dalgity
Reviews.Content: me and my fiance have just returned from a 8 night stay at the ab viladomat and i can hardly fault it. the hotel is clean, the majority of the staff bent over backwards to help and wer very friendly, there wer 2 members off staff on the front dest who i found a tad rude, but manybe it was a cultural differnce, i dont know. our room was large and clean, cant fault it at all. we had a room on the first floor at the front, if/when we go back, i'll be asking for a room at the back, where it might be a bit quieter at night, because trust me the traffic noice is bad and constant 24/7, but it is a majour city centre, so should have been expected. the dinner menu is very poor though, not much for people who dont want to try out new things, all we wanted was pizza etc. the breakfast buffet was superb and left us full up untill late afternoon. i was quite disapointed about how far the beach was from the hotel, we had read that it was much closer, it was a good hour long walk, but an enjoyable one. if your not up to walking, jusst get a taxi, their cheap and one with a green light will stop anywhere, just stick your hand out. the city is great, so much to do. must do's are the beach, it's no over crowded an it's clean, allthough watch out for the asian women trying to sell massages and the beer sellers trying to sell drugs, both started to get on my nerves after a few times of bein asked. a trip to the zoo, it's so varied and the animals seem quite happy, unlike other zoo's i've visited, you HAVE to watch the dolphin show if you go to the zoo. the zoo's located in a large park just up from the beach, quite hard to find. the open top busses are a great way to see the city and plan what to visit, we got a 2 day pass, first day we just stayed on and decided what stops to get off the next day. la ramblas, a street just up from the port is a great street, full of street entertainers, stay out of the tacky tourist shops though, they pester you to buy all their chep tat. there are many other great things to see and do in barcelona, but i'll leave those for you to find yourself.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jean-PhilippeB
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 nights in June 2007 in this hotel with my wife and my son. We got a large room with a single bed and a queen bed. Everything looks brand new and very clean. The room is little bit noisy but you are not in Barcelona to stay in the room ! The breakfast buffet offers a large choice of pastries, Spanish specialties and fresh dishes. I think this is perhaps one of the best price/ratio in Barcelona hotels. I would recommend this hotel without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Nice basic hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Jodie_1984
Reviews.Content: Well me and my partner have just arrived back from a 3 night break at AB Viladomat! Overall we had a great time. We arrived around 11.00pm and went straight to the room which was very spacious and clean and tidy, we where on the 6th floor thank god because I think if we were any lower the traffic would have drove me mad, you couldnt leave the windows open at night due to the high noise level. On out first day we went to Le Rambles via the Metro (Which is great I recommed a 3 day travel pass for 13 euros each) which is very busy and full of tourists, however I wasnt overly impressed by the lack of shops there didnt seem to be many , but lots of stalls ect. In the afternoon we went to the aquarium which I wouldnt bother going to, its well over priced and not a lot to see. We also visited the Zoo, Gaudi's Catherdrol and Nu Camp which where all excellent, and all resoniblily priced... I would def recommend these esp the Zoo, Also a resturant on Le Rambles called Attic is EXCELLENT!! Gr8 service and food but also make reservations it can be sooooooooo busy!! Overall Barcelona is gr8, loads to do but make sure you go with loads on money as most things cost..

Reviews.Title: “pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: teeneyweenies
Reviews.Content: just returned from 5 days in barcelona. great time had by all. had consulted trip advisor before i went for some advice and reviews of hotels. this one was a gem although further from sants station than we had expected. so cheap taxi perhaps a good idea .should cost no more than 10 euros for 4 people and luggage. hotel was great for 3 star accom. very clean, staff very friendly, breakfasts varied and plentiful. only gripe would be dinner. had very expensive and not to our taste dinner. ie veg was artichokes.perhaps something plainer and more suiting all tastes. cheap and cheerful, maybe burgers chips, steak chips,would be more appropriate. anyway great hotel would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel for price”
Reviews.Author: kscottedinburgh
Reviews.Content: Very clean & comfortable small hotel. close to Metro for getting around but not many restuarants locally for evening meals.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice 3 star accomodation.”
Reviews.Author: Ban HamishLondon England
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a week at AB Viladomat and can confirm that this is an above average 3 star hotel. It is spotlessly clean and the staff are very attentive. The metro is not too far and is by far the way to get around. We took a 5 day Barcelona card which gave free travel on all the local transport. I would not recommend use of the buses inthe city centre the traffic is horrendous. The hotel restaurant is expensive for evening meals and a very very poor choice, which is never changed, at least not while we were there. We found an excellent Chinese restaurant at 167 C.Diputacion which is three blocks down from Viladomat and four or five blocks left. Its called FU-HUA Restaurante Chino. Very reasnonable prices and immaculate premises and staff.. Our room was 110 and I`m sorry to say we had to buy earplugs to stop the traffic noise outside. We would however return. Excellent supermarket across the road if you forget anything. Vat 69 £4 60p per bottle. Brilliant!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
