Reviews.Author: BandGLiverpool
Reviews.Content: Just got back from Barcelona yesterday. We loved the hotel AB Viladomat. Our room was great, comfortable bed, gorgeous bathroom, what more do you want. The staff at the hotel were great, they really went out of their way to help make our stay an enjoyable one. We got absolutely drenched in the torrential rain on Saturday and they even dried our clothes for us at not cost. We did have a bit of a problem with the rain coming in through our window but it was absolutely torrential and nothing that a visit from the chambermaid and a few towels couldn't sort out. The hotel offered us another room but we declined because it really wasn't that big a deal. We kept our room on til 7pm last night because of our late flight time and they didn't charge us the standard 30€ because of the problem with the rain. The breakfasts were absolutely gorgeous, every possible breakfast dish you could imagine was there, including smoked salmon and the yummiest fluffliest scrambled egg ever. Yes the hotel is a trek away from the centre of Barcelona (about a 30 - 40 minute walk but the metro is convenient and cheap and a taxi only costs about 6€) but Barcelona is so big anyway that it's impossible to be near everything. We would recommend this hotel, it was great!

Reviews.Title: “Nice plase to stay”
Reviews.Author: tocai
Reviews.Content: It's has been a nice suprise, also comperad with the price. (very chip). Our room was very clean and preatty big and the staff has been very polite and helpfull. If you are not looking for a modern 4 stars hotel I will saggest you to go there. The only inconveniet was the metro and it's about 1 km far away, but the buses work very well in Barcelona and the bus stop was nearer.

Reviews.Title: “Great accommodation”
Reviews.Author: JohnboyH
Reviews.Content: Like all other reviews, we found this was a very good standard of accommodation although we must have had one of the smaller bathrooms. Also found that the bar closed at 1130 (is this winter times only?) We booked via a newspaper advert for two nights and also found it to be a bit far from main sites/metro stations. We took taxi from airport and paid 26 euros to the hotel and paid 18 euros to get back to the airport(?) But you can get the train to Sants station (10-15 minutes form hotel) We reckon closer to 15 minutes to get to metro (Urgell) station. I agree that the bus turisitic trip (go to placa Catalunya or Sants Station) is a must. It was 18 euros for one day or 22 for a two day pass (take the 2-day). There are two routes (North and South) and they were fantastic and you can leave the bus at any stop and get back on at any stop. We had best and worst of eating exeriences...on first night went to a local (5 minutes from hotel) cafe/bar and while the owner gave us a selection of ham/sausage/cheese/bread it cost us 44euros...saw us coming there! On the other hand, we went to a (newish) stylish tapas restaurant/bar just off la rambla (called Sinatras) and the food and wine was to die for and only cost us 39 euros. Visited Harbour area/Sagrada Familia/Parc Guel/La Rambla/Catalunya Square and found whole experience fantastic. Never realised what a large, diverse, intersesting city Barcelona is and can't wait to go back ...but maybe in Spring or Autumn.

Reviews.Title: “3 star plus”
Reviews.Author: conanet
Reviews.Content: from glasgow just got back 30th november from a 4 day visit, great city.and a good value hotel........very pleasant, more than expected for a 3 star, spotlessly clean , great service, staff very pleasant and helpful, great buffet breakfast to suit everyone,.......nice food , a 15 -20 min walk to centre but lots of interesting shops and restaurants on route if you go down side streets, less than 20 euros from airport by taxi, overall a great stay and would recommend, i will go back..........

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: GRAEMEMU
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent hotel for a 3 star. Rooms were large, tasteful and clean. Well serviced. Massive bathroom. Air conditioning excellent. Friendly bar/coffee shop. Great buffet breakfast. Staff very friendly, helpful & efficient. I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again. Only a 10-15 minute saunter to Las Ramblas. Similar time to rail station if visiting Monsterrat for instance. 5 minute stroll to Metro station. 5 minute stroll to/from Airport bus stop. Plenty local shops/bars/cafes nearby if you want to avoid the tourist traps.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: di.1
Reviews.Content: Hotel is clean & staff very helpfull. Just a very short & cheap taxi ride to Las Ramblas.

Reviews.Title: “Decent enough”
Reviews.Author: Vagueos
Reviews.Content: Getting accommodation in Barcelona can be tricky if you want to keep to a reasonable budget. We booked this hotel as it scored reasonably highly on tripadvisor, without costing the earth as we were staying in the city for a week. This hotel is fine for what we needed, it's clean and modern, the staff are friendly and the area it is located in is safe. A couple of things worth noting, if you like going out or shopping etc then it may be better to stay closer to the centre. Although it is not a big city, getting about can be tiring and the hotel is a little bit away from the main areas you want to be in. If i return to Barcelona (great place by the way) then I would probably stay close to Passegia de Gracia, it is central but is far enough away to avoid being trapped in tourist land. Also it has the best gaudi type architecture and has loads of shops, bars and restaurants. The other thing about the hotel was access to the web proved to be difficult as they don't appear to have a permanent room set up, this was a bit annoying but perhaps i was just unlucky. If you are looking for a hotel on a budget then this is ideal, however I'll probably return to Barcelona but spend a bit more on accomodation next time.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for a Weekend Break”
Reviews.Author: Gyle
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a girls weekend and would highly recommend this hotel. The rooms were large and very clean. The hotel is only a 10 minute walk from The Ramblas, we also used taxis which cost only a few euros. If I return to Barcelona then I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: C.Glenn
Reviews.Content: This hotel was chosen for me so I checked it out on TRIPADVISOR. All reviews were positive and my experience mirrored those. The location is very good 'though it falls between a couple of Metro stations and isn't really that close to either. Also the walking times given on the hotel website are a bit optimistic ( and I'm a brisk walker) but it is very well served by buses and taxis. The hotel dining room was closed (except for very good breakfasts) when I was there so I can't comment on that but everything else is clean,modern and efficient. The best thing about the hotel is the demeanour of all the staff who are particularly friendly and helpful. I would be very happy to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: kerreye
Reviews.Content: For the price, this hotel is awesome. 15 minute walk to La Rambla and close to buses/metro. Would recommend this hotel to anyone. Large clean rooms, high quality finishings and air con.

Reviews.Title: “Viva Viladomat”
Reviews.Author: malachOR59
Reviews.Content: Had a great time in Barcelona...part of it thanks to Hotel Viladomat. It´s easily accessible from Sants Train station (bus 44) or get a taxi (a couple of euros). Supermarket across the street. But most of all the staff were so nice and helpful. Take the Bus Turistica. Wonderful buffet breakfast...regular hotel price. Very clean rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Contemporary Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jph948
Reviews.Content: We took a taxi from the airport to the hotel in 20 minutes and costing 15 euros. The lobby and decor is bright and modern, if not slightly art-deco. Our large room had wood floors and a high ceiling. It was spacious and airy with a king bed. No frig but there are many markets and cafes down the street for meals. It was not close to Las Ramblas, but Barcelona is a walking city. The spring weather was 70 degrees and perfect when we arrived on May12th. We tried to eat dinner at six, but were told most places don't even serve until 8 or later. That's when we're usually in bed! Anyway, be prepared to eat around nine at night. We picked a family-run restaurant where they spoke no English and got by through pointing. A word of caution: if you eat Mexican, the same item in Arizona is different in Spain. Our tostada was not what we expected, but still tasty. The house/local wine is always the best. Try the Sangria. We ate breakfast at an outdoor (aren't they all?) cafe with terrific coffee and pastries. Back at the hotel, the staff was friendly and helpful. There is a bar/restaurant downstairs, but we preferred to explore outside. We were going on a cruise and they told us we could walk to the pier. It took 2 and half hours!!! But a nice walk, nevertheless. You might opt for a cab. The only downside was the shopping district is a few miles away. But we love to walk. And in such a beautiful city in the spring, who wouldn't?

Reviews.Title: “great great great”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: good points 1.great breakfast - i had chocolate cake (i know its sounds strange but when on holiday why not 2.good rooms (had 2) tolitries replinished, bed clean changed daily(didn't need to be done) 3.transport to city centre easly done (train, tax, bus, airport bus and metro (underground train) 4.good size cosy and confortable 5.lovely staff very polite, good english, 6.mini bar prices good (good for storin other food items) bad points 1.wardrobe door came off hedges (not bothered about that) 2.restraunt- nice but expensive overall it was a great hotel , great area (bit nosiy but it was the morning so what the hay), took a few condements and amenditence (who doesnt) imagne taking home a comb and shoe buffer!!!! great weather even though it was october the wetest time of the year!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: Pittyman67
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. Got a good deal through Globespan for 5 nights B&B (inc flights) for the two of us for just over £520. Room clean and tidy with working air-conditioning. Fresh toiletries and towels every day. Good breakfast if you are into continental, wouldn't recommend the frankfurters and scrambled eggs though. Recommend getting a 2-day ticket for the tourist bus. Go round the routes on day 1 and jump off and on on day 2. Go to see Park Guell, La Padrera Montjuc and the Nou Camp. Las Ramblas is over-rated for what it is. Hotel is about a 20 minute walk from Placa Cataluyna. Better to walk 10 minutes to Sans Station Underground. Ten trips on the underground costs about 6.5 Euros and is easy to get about. Would certainly recommend a trip to Barcelona and a stay at the AB Viladomat.

Reviews.Title: “Good - but!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We found the staff to be very pleasant and helpful. The air conditioning was not working and the room was hot and we needed to sleep with the windows open for fresh air, we were on the 6th floor but in a room at the front of the hotel and there was constant traffic noise all through the night. We thought the buffet breakfast at 25 euros per couple was not particularly good value when compared to the many bars round and about, although It was fine if you like to eat cakes for breakfast. I have MS (all of the hotel is easily accessible so didn't cause any problems) because of this we used taxis as it was too far for me to walk into Barcelona, we did walk to Sants station once, but as this took me about 35 minutes in the morning, and lot longer in the afternoon, we used taxis to get in and out of Barcelona each day, which cost between 3 and 5 euros. If you are fit you could easily walk to Sants station or into Barcelona centre in about 10 to 20 minutes. The taxis to and from the airport cost 25 euros one way and 27 the other. The hotel reception and our bedroom and bathroom were very clean with extra toiletries each day.. We arrived on 23rd April, and it is a tradition in Catelonia for ladies to be presented with a red rose, so it was a nice surpise to be given a long stemmed red rose when we checked in. The Bus Touristic, at 22 euros each for two days unlimited travel or 18 euros for one day (and this included all three routes) was excellent value as it gives you an insight into the location of the various sights and you can plan where and when you want to get off the bus. A tip for the bus - don't insist on going upstairs or you will be waiting a long time, get on and sit downstairs and as soon as seats become available upstairs, the guides offer you the chance to change seats before they let anyone else on. We will go back to Barcelona, not to this hotel, but purely because of it's location and the lack of air conditioning.

Reviews.Title: “one word......FANTASTIC.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Me and the wife stayed at the villadomat for 3 nights in march.After reading the reviews on here we decieded to give it a go.And we were not disappointed.The hotel was very nice.Our room was small but ok for just the 2 of us.I couldn't fault the maid service.We even had a welcome with our names on the tv when we first turned the tele on.That was a nice touch. The location was excellent.We didn't want to be in the centre.A taxi ride was about 6/7 minuites away from catalunya.We travelled on the underground tube.The nearest station was about a 15 minuite walk.Which was not a problem with us.Buy a T10 ticket.This will give you 10 passes on the underground for just over 6 euro.Otherwise it will cost you 1 euro 20 for a single ticket. We went to the camp nou to watch barcelona.Which was a great experience.We paid £27 each for our tickets which is even cheaper than watching my beloved wolves. I would recommended the bus tour.For about £15 each you see the whole city.You can get off anytime and see the sights.There is 2 routes the blue line and red line.We done the both in the 1 day. I would recommend the nou camp tour followed by the musuem too. We took extra care in the ramblas as we read about pickpockets and muggings.But we never had any problem.I bought some barcelona football stuff from the shops on the ramblas,i bartered with some of them and i got a cap down from 10 euro to 6 euro so it's worth a go. overall i would give villadomat 10/10 and barcelona 9 and half out of 10.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel... Great breakfast!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel... clean, convenient and modern-style rooms... Good value for money... and a great breakfast service (included in the price)!! There is a various and premium buffet (even smoked salmon, jamon, cheese and every sort of cakes)... Only little issue... a little bit far from the center of the city (10-15 min walk to get to the rambla).. and no metro station near...(university is the nearest).. Anyway... great place to stay in Barcelona!

Reviews.Title: “AB Viladomat - Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 3 night city break to Barcelona. We booked this hotel through easyjet and it was a really good price as it included a buffet breakfast with everything you could want. The rooms were a little small but really nicely decorated. The hotel is situated slightly out of the main tourist area, about a 25min walk. But there are a couple of metro stations near by and is only about €4 in a taxi to the centre. Found no complaints at all about this hotel, really good quality and value for money and wouldn't hesitate to recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “AB Viladomat: My home in Barcelona! ”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: It was a really good surprise for my husband and I to find an extremly good hotel in our visit to Barcelona : AB VILADOMAT HOTEL. We could just say that the overall services were very good, restaurant and recepcion staff are very friendly and good professionals. We were highly sastified with the information received (with a big smile) about Barcelona, including places of interest such as: touristic buses, museums, restaurants, entertainment...How wonderful ! We enjoyed the good service at the breakfast buffet and dinner; food was of high quality and all our needs were answered by the brisk and friendly waiters. Our room was really clean, large and bright, with a very modern decoration, and we felt like staying at home. We made lots of friends at AB Viladomat hotel....we will definitely come back.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at AB Valadomat”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Valadomat Feb 06, On the 6th floor, room very clean! Breakfast was in with the price and it was superb! Metro,s 15 min walk, Staff very pleasant and they couldn,t do enough for you, very good..Good restaurant,s 5-10 min walk away and a lot cheaper than eating out down La Rambler,s..Done an awful lot of walking from where the Valadomat was, but we thoroughly enjoyed it.. I would stay at this hotel again...

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After only 12 hours in the place - claims air con but only in summer. Boiled an egg in the room. Did not know you had to pay extra for a smile. Male receptionist needed his hair washed and cut. Would book tours only with Julia. Chosen tour was booked out, not advised until I enquired about the outcome. Told that if I wanted to book with another copmpany then I had to go the tourism office at the station. Asked to see manager, no night manager, told he would be in at 9am which came and went then told bluntly by the Commercial Manager that the manager had other things to do. Arrogance and not service is the rule. Could not get out of the place soon enough.

Reviews.Title: “robbery”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: being robbed at the hotel reception when arriving, not getting any compensation by so far i would not reccommend the hotel to anyone

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: wrightser
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the AB Viladomat for two nights in early Feb 2006. Overall we were very happy with every aspect of the hotel. Location: The location is fine. It is just a short 15 min walk from Sants station from where you can catch trains, metro, bus to anywhere in the city. The airport bus which we took stops behind the station. We used Rocafort Metro station when going into town - its a short 10 min walk down Viladomat Street from the hotel and is only 3 stops from Placa Catalunya where your touring of the city should begin. Rooms: The room we had was on the 5th floor and was spotless. The beds are comfortable and the room was reasonably spacious. The shower was excellent too. Service: We didn't eat at the hotel preferring to eat our breakfasts at one of the many nearby cafés. The buffet also seemed a bit expensive at €12.50 per person - when we could get a nice feed for under €5 just down the street. The staff were extremely friendly and courteous. I would recommend this hotel wholeheartedly for anyone who wants to stay in a nice neighbourhood but not too far from all the action. By the way, I thought the Ramblas was disappointing. The rest of Barcelona is fantastic.... Marty from Dublin

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: Gadgetmonsteruk
Reviews.Content: This was our first time in Barcelona so choosing the Hotel was a bit hit or miss in this case we hit it right. Although away from the main tourist areas, it proved to be right for us. The staff were very helpful and courteous, the hotel exceptionally clean with an excellent restaurant. Catching the tourist bus from the Sants Terminal proved very easy. If you choose to fly into Gerona with a budget airline be warned catching any other mode of transport other than the Barcelona Bus is expensive. Queuing is unheard of and when the flights arrive, it is a bit of a free for all and make sure you buy your ticket before getting on the bus. If you have never been, Barcelona is a beautiful city with many types of architecture so even if it is just for a weekend it is well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, great value!!!”

Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 night at the beginning of jenuary. We had a great time, staff is very friendly and helpful, room was spacious enaugh, all facilities avalaible, the bathroom was clean and new. It's a 3 star hotel but it has a four star facilities! We spent only 50 € per night, minibar at reasonable prices! Hotel location is quite good, very close to Saints train station, 7-10 minutes walk from the underground. If you like to walk you can reach placa Catalunya in 25 minutes, very pleasent walk. The surrounding area seems to be safe. There is a little good supermarket on the right side of the hotel. Barcelona is a beautiful city,with nice inhabitants! Enjoy your stay!
